sentences.english: Beauty of love, always as the miserable Bana general.
sentences.chinese: 悽美的愛情，總是如彼岸花壹般的悽慘。

sentences.english: Iago. What are you here that cry so grievously ?
sentences.chinese: 伊阿古你是什麼人，在這兒叫喊得這樣悽慘？

sentences.english: He couldn't erase the tragic scene from his memory.
sentences.chinese: 他無法把那悽慘情景從記憶中抹去。

sentences.english: We are all pathetic victims of the muddle-headed Ministry.
sentences.chinese: 我們都是昏了頭的魔法部下悽慘的犧牲品。

sentences.english: The grandfather and his grandson led a miserable life.
sentences.chinese: 祖孫倆過着悽慘的生活。

sentences.english: Several thousand year agos, the woman should be a windy and rainy miserably and miserably troubled at heart graceful and restrained parties.
sentences.chinese: 數千年前，女人都應該是悽悽慘慘慼戚的婉約派。

sentences.english: Gratiano. 'Tis some mischance; the cry is very direful.
sentences.chinese: 葛萊西安諾出了什麼亂子啦？這叫聲很是悽慘。

sentences.english: Battles bring hopelessness, fear, and dark side and gruesomeness.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭帶來的是絕望，恐慌，黑暗面，悽慘。

sentences.english: Nothing makes you feel more miserable about work than the need to keep working to pay for items you bought with money you didn’t have.
sentences.chinese: 沒有比你努力工作來買自己買不起的東西更悽慘的了。

sentences.english: Beauty of love, always as the miserable Bana general.
sentences.chinese: 悽美地愛情，老是如彼岸花壹般地悽慘。

sentences.english: Patty began to cry again very desolately.
sentences.chinese: 帕蒂再一次悽慘地哭了起來。

sentences.english: The animals you eat lead lives of misery and suffering from birth to death.
sentences.chinese: 你喫的動物從出生到死亡一直過着悽慘而痛苦的生活。

definition: lit. seeing others go hunting, one is excited by memories of the thrill of the hunt (idiom)/fig. seeing others do what one loves to do, one is inspired to try it again
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
